p: S-1 might be another candidate for mild adjuvant chemotherapy for NSCLC. The oral fluoropyrimidine derivative which consists of tegafur and two modulators, 5-chloro-2,4-dihydroxypyridine (CDHP) and potassium oxonate (Oxo), enhances 5-FU efficacy by inhibiting degradation of 5-FU and reduces the GI toxicity caused by 5-FU [ 5]. The significant effects with low adverse reactions of S-1 monotherapy in an adjuvant treatment have been proven in randomized phase III trials in digestive cancers including gastric, pancreatic and colon adenocarcinomas [ 6– 8]. Accordingly, S-1 based adjuvant chemotherapy has been used as an option of standard treatment in intestinal cancers. Further, S-1 also has efficacy against squamous cell carcinomas including head and neck, oral, esophagus and thymus [ 9– 11], suggesting S-1 is effective on both squamous carcinomas and adenocarcinomas.
